page.title: 08BORDERS SHEEPSKIN CO.
page.content: This is a very large factory on the Bankend Estate beside the R.Jed. When we arrived there was a strong smell in the air and we found out why when we were taken around.The skins of sheep and goats were being washed and put into piles-they were being graded.They use a lot of chemicals which would pollute the drains so they have their own anti-pollution settling tanks,including a big new one. Inside the factory,water was being sprayed from pipes to keep the air moist.Over 1,000,000 skins a year are dealt with,and pickled pelts value Â£3,000,000 are exported each year. Big lorries leave Jedburgh regularly with skins valued at over Â£100,000 going mainly to Italy,also France and Turkey.Skins also go to N.America. Over 40 people are employed.
